general

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckerBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a square board with BoardSquares of alternating colors. Each space can hold one Piece.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Piece[][] board
      Holds all of the Pieces on the board.
      private general.BoardSquare[][] boardPanels
      Holds all of the BoardSquares that make up the board.
      private javax.swing.JPanel mainPanel
      JPanel which can be used by another program for a GUI display.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int size, java.awt.Color c1, java.awt.Color c2)
      Creates a new board with all of its BoardSquares.

    • Method Summary

      Counts the number of pieces on the board.

      Counts the number of pieces with the specified Color.

      Gets a JPanel which can be used in a GUI to display the current state of the board.

      Gets the Piece at a specified position.

      Moves a Piece, without any checks for validity, and updates the BoardSquares appropriately.

      Creates a String with a picture of the board using each Piece's icon.
      void updatePanels()

        Holds all of the Pieces on the board.

        Holds all of the BoardSquares that make up the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int size,
             java.awt.Color c1,
             java.awt.Color c2)
        Creates a new board with all of its BoardSquares.
        Parameters:
        size - The height and width of this board in squares.
        c1 - The color used on all BoardSquare where the sum of their coordinates is even.
        c2 - The color used on all BoardSquare where the sum of their coordinates is odd.

    • Method Detail

      • updatePanels

        public void updatePanels()
        Sets the Piece for each BoardSquare to the one at its position.

      • move

        public void move(int[] from,
                 int[] to)
        Moves a Piece, without any checks for validity, and updates the BoardSquares appropriately.
        Parameters:
        from - The position of the Piece to move.
        to - The final position of the Piece.
        If the array is longer than 2 (in the case of multiple jumps), the last 2 values are used.

      • hasMoves

        public boolean hasMoves(java.awt.Color c)
        Finds whether there are any pieces on the board of a certain color which can make a valid move. This can be used to check a victory condition for some games.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to look for.
        Returns:
        Whether or not any pieces with that color can move.

      • countPieces

        public int countPieces()
        Counts the number of pieces on the board. This can be used to check if any pieces have been captured.
        Returns:
        The number of pieces.

      • countPieces

        public int countPieces(java.awt.Color c)
        Counts the number of pieces with the specified Color. This can be used to check a victory condition for some games.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to look for.
        Returns:
        The number of pieces with that color.

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece(int row,
                      int col)
        Gets the Piece at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the board, starting at 0 for the top.
        col - The column of the board, starting at 0 for the side.
        Returns:
        The Piece at row, col.

      • getPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
        Gets a JPanel which can be used in a GUI to display the current state of the board.
        Returns:
        This board;s panel.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a String with a picture of the board using each Piece's icon. Includes numerical labels for rows and alphabetical labels for columns.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The picture of the board.
